alert.note: Alert for Central and Eastern Lake County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 28 at 1:45PM PST until December 30 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 4 AM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 7 inches below 5000 ft. Above 5000 feet, snow accumulations of 10 to 15 inches with winds gusting as high as 40 to 50 mph expected. * WHERE...Western Lake County, mainly west of Highway 31. This includes portions of highways 395 and 140 and the communities of Lakeview and Valley Falls. * WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 4 AM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The advisory spans a lengthy period due to multiple impulses expected pass through with very little break in between. The greatest snow accumulation is expected early Thursday morning, then again Thursday evening into Friday morning. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
